javadoc:
Dialog that is displayed to show activity for a Task that is running outside of the 
 Swing Thread.

methods.name: <init>

params.name: centerOnComp
params.comment:
component to be centered over when shown,
 otherwise center over parent.  If both centerOnComp and parent
 are null, dialog will be centered on screen.

params.name: task
params.comment: the Task that this dialog will be associated with

methods.javadoc:
Constructor
@param task the Task that this dialog will be associated with
methods.name: <init>

params.name: task
params.comment: the Task that this dialog will be associated with

methods.name: <init>

params.name: canCancel
params.comment: true if the task can be canceled

params.name: isModal
params.comment: true if the dialog should be modal

params.name: hasProgress
params.comment: true if the dialog should show a progress bar

methods.name: <init>

params.name: centerOnComp
params.comment:
component to be centered over when shown, otherwise center over 
        parent.  If both centerOnComp is null, then the active window will be used

params.name: isModal
params.comment: true if the dialog should be modal

params.name: canCancel
params.comment: true if the task can be canceled

params.name: hasProgress
params.comment: true if the dialog should show a progress bar

methods.javadoc:
Shows a dialog asking the user if they really, really want to cancel the task
@return true if the task should be cancelled
methods.name: promptToVerifyCancel
methods.comment: Shows a dialog asking the user if they really, really want to cancel the task

return.comment: true if the task should be cancelled

methods.javadoc: Adds the panel that contains the progress bar to the dialog
methods.name: installProgressMonitor
methods.comment: Adds the panel that contains the progress bar to the dialog

methods.javadoc:
Adds the panel that contains the activity panel (e.g., the eating bits animation) to the 
 dialog. This should only be called if the dialog has no need to display progress.
methods.name: installActivityDisplay
methods.comment:
Adds the panel that contains the activity panel (e.g., the eating bits animation) to the 
 dialog. This should only be called if the dialog has no need to display progress.

methods.name: show
methods.comment:
Shows the dialog window centered on the parent window.
 Dialog display is delayed if delay greater than zero.

params.name: delay
params.comment:
number of milliseconds to delay displaying of the task dialog.  If the delay is
 greater than #MAX_DELAY, then the delay will be #MAX_DELAY;

name: TaskDialog
comment:
Dialog that is displayed to show activity for a Task that is running outside of the 
 Swing Thread.

fields.javadoc: Timer used to give the task a chance to complete
fields.name: SLEEPY_TIME
fields.comment: Timer used to give the task a chance to complete

fields.javadoc: Amount of time to wait before showing the monitor dialog
fields.name: MAX_DELAY
fields.comment: Amount of time to wait before showing the monitor dialog

fields.javadoc: If not null, then the value of the string has yet to be rendered
fields.name: newMessage
fields.comment: If not null, then the value of the string has yet to be rendered
